Loic Zimmermann is a French director and visual artist based in Los Angeles, developing works that encompass illustration, photography, and film. Zimmermann moved to California in 2008 to work as a concept artist for VFX, contributing to many Marvel blockbusters, including  ,  , and  , as well as films such as  ,  , and  . In directing his own projects, Zimmermann finds a medium that allows for collaborative work while giving him a wide range of tools to experiment with. His experience as a photographer and as an illustrator have a direct impact on his cinematography, while his understanding and practice of digital tools allow him to tackle any subject. His first book, e338: The Art of Loic Zimmermann, was published in 2014, regrouping a decade of his personal and professional production. ?
